trustfund:
BBNSA3-BB NEW SPENDING AUTHORITY 3,TF025386-PHRD-COMMERCIAL BANKING
            RESTRUCTURING PROJECT,TF029463-PHRD- BANGLADESH-COMMERCIAL
            BANKING RESTRUCTURING,TF029467-PHRD-PRIVATE SECTOR SUPPORT SERVICES

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Central Bank
            Strengthening Project is to achieve a strong and effective
            regulatory and supervisory system for Bangladesh's
            banking sector. The reallocation is necessary to allow
            Bangladesh Bank (BB) to utilize the unused funds to finance
            existing components and three new activities not included in
            the original project. The reallocation of unused funds for
            the new activities will contribute substantially toward the
            better achievement of the project development objective
            (PDO) and PDO output and outcome indicators. There is only a
            reallocation of funds from an existing component to support
            three new activities that are nevertheless consistent with
            Bangladesh Bank's (BB's) priority reform agenda
            which this project is supporting. The three new activities
            are: (i) National Payment Switch (NPS) and e-Payment
            Gateway, (ii) IT System for Anti-Money Laundering Department
            (AMLD) for Suspicious Transaction Reporting (STR) and Cash
            Transaction Reporting (CTR), and (iii) system for Public
            Accounts Department (PAD). International Development
            Association (IDA) has agreed to finance National Payment
            Switch (NPS) and e-Payment Gateway 100 percent of the
            expenditure up to a maximum amount of SDR3.8149 million (USD
            6.0 million). A separate sub-category under (one) goods will
            be created for this activity. The three new activities will
            contribute substantially toward achievement of the PDO and
            PDO output and outcome indicators.
